content:
Online book clubs and reading challenges can be a fantastic way to connect with fellow readers, discover new books, and stay motivated to read. Here are some popular ones that might interest you, given your love for historical fiction and book clubs:

1. **The Historical Fiction Book Club** on Goodreads: This group has over 10,000 members and focuses specifically on historical fiction. They have monthly reads, discussions, and author Q&As.
2. **The Book Club** on Facebook: This group has over 100,000 members and features a new book every month. While not exclusively historical fiction, they often feature historical fiction titles and have a dedicated historical fiction subgroup.
3. **The Historical Fiction Challenge** on Goodreads: This challenge encourages readers to explore historical fiction from different time periods and genres. You can set your own goals and participate in discussions with fellow readers.
4. **The Reading Challenge** on Goodreads: This challenge has various categories, including historical fiction. You can set a goal for the number of books you want to read and participate in discussions with other readers.
5. **The Historical Tapestry** reading challenge: This challenge focuses on historical fiction set in different time periods and regions. It's a great way to explore new authors and time periods.
6. **The Century of Books** challenge: This challenge encourages readers to read a book from each year of the 20th century. It's a great way to explore historical fiction and non-fiction from different decades.
7. **The Popsugar Reading Challenge**: This challenge features a list of prompts and categories, including historical fiction. It's a fun way to mix up your reading and discover new books.
8. **The Book of the Month Club**: This club sends a new hardcover book to your doorstep every month. They often feature historical fiction titles, and you can participate in online discussions with fellow readers.
9. **The Literary Guild**: This online book club features a new book every month, often with a historical fiction focus. They have author Q&As, discussions, and behind-the-scenes insights.
10. **The Historical Fiction Authors Cooperative**: This group features a new historical fiction title every month, often with author Q&As and giveaways.

These are just a few examples of online book clubs and reading challenges that might interest you. Feel free to explore and find the ones that best fit your reading preferences and schedule!

Remember to always read and participate at your own pace, and don't be afraid to reach out to the community or moderators if you have any questions or need recommendations. Happy reading!
